intro: Habranthus amambaicus, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Peru. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
